text: Rust is starting to come off as the most complicated programming language I've ever tried to learn

elements.text: Rust is starting to come off as the most complicated programming language I've ever tried to learn

text:
Not surprised :blush:

I don't think anyone sells it as "user friendly" :blush:

The selling point is safety and for that, I believe it is hard to beat.

elements.text: Not surprised
I don't think anyone sells it as "user friendly"
The selling point is safety and for that, I believe it is hard to beat.
(aside from speed etc)

text: Microsoft is apparently moving some of their core stuff from C++ to Rust.

elements.text: Microsoft is apparently moving some of their core stuff from C++ to Rust.

text: yea I've heard a lot of these success stories but wow - it's a doozy. That said writing good C++ is also a doozy

elements.text: yea I've heard a lot of these success stories but wow - it's a doozy. That said writing good C++ is also a doozy

text: maybe writing Julia has just made me lazy...

elements.text: maybe writing Julia has just made me lazy...

text: There's also a shift - Rust is very much "pay for your design .mistakes at compile time and  not at runtime" which takes some vetting used

elements.text: There's also a shift - Rust is very much "pay for your design .mistakes at compile time and  not at runtime" which takes some vetting used

text: I'm okay with that to an extent, but, it's pretty brutal. I feel like I've never used a language that required the user to be this aware of a compiler at all times

elements.text: I'm okay with that to an extent, but, it's pretty brutal. I feel like I've never used a language that required the user to be this aware of a compiler at all times
Better rhan blowing up prod :/
Ughhhh typos

text: that's what keeps drawing me back too it. Every hr I put in I'm ready to quit, but then I'm like - its probably worth sticking it out. Then I look at what I've gotten done, and how much is left to go to do something trivial, and I'm like :ahhhhhhh:

text: Yeah, but hey, C would let you shoot yourself. And you wouldn't even know.

elements.text: Yeah, but hey, C would let you shoot yourself. And you wouldn't even know.

text: I've shot myself with C++ dozens of times

elements.text: I've shot myself with C++ dozens of times

text: actually maybe GoLang... Seems a lot easier, going to take performance hits but - that's life I guess

text: You probably said and I missed it, but what is your motivation? You just want to learn a new language or you have something in mind?

elements.text: You probably said and I missed it, but what is your motivation? You just want to learn a new language or you have something in mind?

text: I really like Rust already. I knew Rustaceans spoke about "safety" all the time, but boy it does shine through to the language. Having to lean on the compiler instead of tests to even figure out what you code does is a different experience.

elements.text: I really like Rust already. I knew Rustaceans spoke about "safety" all the time, but boy it does shine through to the language. Having to lean on the compiler instead of tests to even figure out what you code does is a different experience.

text:
I have a few projects in mind with a solo dev(me). Not doing it purely for fun. But not for professional use either.

I think Rust is an awesome idea but holy moly it's not for the faint hearted. You basically need a strong backbone in C++ to understand it, but it's not like knowing C++ really helps you learn it. More so learn the problems that show up in systems level C++ and then you can appreciate Rust.

elements.text:
I have a few projects in mind with a solo dev(me). Not doing it purely for fun. But not for professional use either.

I think Rust is an awesome idea but holy moly it's not for the faint hearted. You basically need a strong backbone in C++ to understand it, but it's not like knowing C++ really helps you learn it. More so learn the problems that show up in systems level C++ and then you can appreciate Rust.
